pr_title: Update acceptance tests with v0.21.0 token rest checks

timeline.message:
Update acceptance tests with v0.21.0 token rest checks

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText:
Will add WebClient bean to the ClientConfiguration. Agree with that.
With this I think it addresses the readability.
OPS requested a log with the full absolute URI, which was easy to do this way, I'll add logs for reactor.netty.http.client.
replies.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: I really dislike the exploded URI segment building. Logging a URI is a cross cutting concern and more appropriate for an interceptor. See filter functions.
replies.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText:
You should configure ObjectMapper to use snake_case so you don't have to manually map all of these.
new ObjectMapper().setPropertyNamingStrategy(PropertyNamingStrategy.SNAKE_CASE);
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Good suggestion, will add to Bean configuration
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText: Do we really need to model all of the fields? Since we can't share domain classes with JavaScript, we should minimize our coupling with its domain model and only model the minimal set of objects and fields that we actually need. That way we don't pay as much of a maintenance cost when we change either side.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.message:
Added WebClient bean and removed unneeded domain properties

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText: imports should be below license. Otherwise next time we run the license plugin it will add another license to the top.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: Would prefer these all named as get or retrieve as they don't actual verify the response. The verification is done in the feature. Also don't like naming it after the transport mechanism. Recommend getAccount().
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Yeah meant to change this. Will do
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: I'm not a fan of exposing HTTP specific objects to the caller. Would prefer returning the domain object and throwing an exception if any error. But current approach is fine for now.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText:
Initially when it was just text checking using the status was useful.
With the POJO mapping checking for null covers non 200 status.
Updated
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.message:
